content: How to use IO.println(or other IO functions) to print MessageData?
I want to print something of MessageData type in the cmd.
If you are meta programming you should use functions like logInfo to deal with message data.
Is it possible to configure the settings to store logs in a file instead of displaying them in the Lean InfoView window?
You could in princple run lean foo.lean > out.txt on the CLI I guess? But no there is not a dedicated option for this. What do you want to do with this?

Quite complex, it is a part of my big action. I want to improve upon the lean-training-data project, to make the two tactic state before(call it A) and after(call it B) a tactic to mix together: make B's conclusion become A's a new hypothesis.I even don't know if it is possible in theory.
@Kyle Miller You saved me a lot of time, thank you so much!
Zihao Zhang has marked this topic as resolved.
